name: Mini Loaves and Fishes
description: This pattern is for making small plush loaves and fishes. Great for Sunday School lessons (please stitch on eyes rather than using the plastic kind if you are using these with small children); or for anyone who just needs a reminder to be faithful with your offering, and to let God do the rest.
full_text: This pattern is for making small plush loaves and fishes. Great for Sunday School lessons (please stitch on eyes rather than using the plastic kind if you are using these with small children); or for anyone who just needs a reminder to be faithful with your offering, and to let God do the rest. I used scrap yarn in my stash for this pattern - one skein of whatever yarn you choose for the bread is likely more than enough. I’m not a professional pattern writer and I’m guessing on yarn quantity! The fish were made out of spare sock yarn I had laying around. These were a little fiddly, but so worth it. I’m sure you can make a large sized set just by using larger needles and more substantial yarn. I’d love to see your projects! Blessings, Jennifer
